TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XpsResource extends System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsPartBase implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Defines the base class for resources that can be added to an .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to add XpsResource derived types to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Commit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Commits all changes and flushes the resource to the document package.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Based on settings of <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationManager> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsPackagingPolicy>, such as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.FontSubsetterCommitPolicies> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.PackageInterleavingOrder>, the flush operation of the Commit method may be delayed until the whole <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> is closed.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Commit method (in a derived class) when you add resources to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IO.Stream GetStream() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the I/O stream for reading or writing the resource.
Docs.returns: The <xref:System.IO.Stream> for reading or writing the resource.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this method (in a derived class) to add resources to an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument>.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#xpscreateaddpageresources)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPageResources](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#xpscreateaddpageresources)]
